basics.name: Charbel Kindji
basics.label: PhD Student
basics.summary: PhD Student working on generative models with an application on tabular data.

work.name: Orange Labs / INRIA - IRISA
work.summary: PhD program in collaboration with Orange Innovation Labs and IRISA.
highlights: Neural networks applied to tabular data.

work.name: Kurmi Software
work.summary: Work-study program as part of my master's degree in big data.
highlights: Develop connectors for the Microsoft Office 365 suite (Powershell, Java, Javascript).
Developing and correcting tests for the software suite Kurmi.

Big Data subject in my work‑study program : Study and characterization of Kurmi users through the analysis of logs generated by the software at the customers’ premises (Python, Java and other tools like KNIME and Power BI)

work.name: INRIA - IRISA
work.summary: Trainee to validate my Bachelor's degree. Technical environment: python and common libraries for data analysis and visualization (NLTK, BeautifulSoup, NetworkX, Pandas, Numpy, Scikit‑learn, Matplotlib, Seaborn, etc.).
highlights: Study of the evolution of science: exploration of large graphs and Natural Language Processing (NLP).
Use of the IGRIDA computational grid for experiments.

work.name: Machine Intelligence For You (MIFY)
work.position: Artificial intelligence intern, then technical management assistant.
work.summary: Post-graduate work experience in machine learning.
highlights: Assistant in a training session in the company SUNU Assurances on the software Microsoft Excel.
Data recovery from a graphics tablet and export to feed a machine learning algorithm.
Preparation of administrative documents for calls for tender.
Improved natural referencing and optimized page loading of the company’s website.

publications.name: Zur Elektrody/namik bewegter Körper
publications.summary: It concerned an interpretation of the Michelson–Morley experiment and the properties of light and time. Special relativity incorporates the principle that the speed of light is the same for all inertial observers regardless of the state of motion of the source.
